intro: Parnassia caroliniana var. cordifolia, commonly known as the Carolina crowfoot, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmately divided leaves and showy, white flowers with yellow centers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a rhizomatous root system and produces small, fleshy fruits that are dispersed by animals. The species is noted for its ornamental value and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
